| /               |                                                                                 |

| Name            | draining                                                                        |
| Appearance      | [random](/wiki/Randomised_appearance "Randomised appearance")                   |
| Base price      | 175 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                                               |
| Weight          | 7                                                                               |
| Type            | beam                                                                            |
| Maximum charges | 8                                                                               |
| Monster use     | *May be used [offensively](/wiki/Offensive_item "Offensive item") by monsters.* |

The **wand of draining** is a new wand introduced in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") and [dNethack](/wiki/DNethack "DNethack"). Similar to a [spellbook of drain life](/wiki/Spellbook_of_drain_life "Spellbook of drain life"), it casts an unreflectable beam which drains a level from its target monster. Like the spellbook, it also drains enchantment (one point at a time) from armor and weapons, and charges from rings, wands, and chargeable tools.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Identification](#Identification)

- [2 Monster use](#Monster_use)

- [3 Protection](#Protection)

  - [3.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [3.2 dNethack](#dNethack)

## Identification

This wand has the same effect as the [spellbook of drain life](/wiki/Spellbook_of_drain_life "Spellbook of drain life"), and will self-identify if this effect is seen. When engraved with, if there is a pre-existing message, it will erase part, or possibly all, of it. This generally produces the message **"The engraving looks different now"** which is shared with the [wand of polymorph](/wiki/Wand_of_polymorph "Wand of polymorph") in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"); however, reading the message will clearly differentiate between the two, as the wand of polymorph produces random, very recognizable rumors. If the pre-existing engraving is sufficiently short, the wand will instead give a message about the engraving disappearing; to avoid this ambiguity with the [other](/wiki/Wand_of_cancellation "Wand of cancellation") [wands](/wiki/Wand_of_teleportation "Wand of teleportation") that [do that](/wiki/Wand_of_make_invisible "Wand of make invisible"), dust-engrave moderately long messages (6 letters is enough) before engrave-testing unidentified wands.

## Monster use

Unfortunately, monsters know how to use these wands all too well. The beam cannot be [reflected](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection"), and [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") provides no protection against it. Monsters are content to empty these wands on you, quite possibly killing you from level drain, and at the very least leaving you considerably weaker. They will very preferentially use these wands against you, it seems. If the [Guild of Disgruntled Adventurers](/wiki/Special_level_\(SLASH%27EM\)#The_Guild_of_Disgruntled_Adventurers "Special level (SLASH'EM)") is generated in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), expect to see large numbers of player monsters carrying these.

In [dNethack](/wiki/DNethack "DNethack"), these wands are much, much rarer than the ones in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") to the point that the player may have difficulty obtaining one, thus vastly reducing their threat (But they are still possibly dangerous; [Binders](/wiki/Binder "Binder") can accidentally unbind [Numina](/wiki/Numina "Numina")). Most players get by without obtaining drain resistance.

## Protection

The only protection against these wands is [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance"). This is a rather obscure property in vanilla nethack that becomes a vital part of an ascension kit in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), mostly due to this wand. It is provided from the following sources:

### SLASH'EM

- Wearing an [amulet of drain resistance](/wiki/Amulet_of_drain_resistance "Amulet of drain resistance").
- Wearing [deep dragon scales](/wiki/Deep_dragon_scales "Deep dragon scales") or [deep dragon scale mail](/wiki/Deep_dragon_scale_mail "Deep dragon scale mail").
- Wielding [Excalibur](/wiki/Excalibur "Excalibur"), [Stormbringer](/wiki/Stormbringer "Stormbringer"), or [The Hand of Vecna](/wiki/The_Hand_of_Vecna_\(SLASH%27EM\) "The Hand of Vecna (SLASH'EM)"); note that the [Staff of Aesculapius](/wiki/Staff_of_Aesculapius "Staff of Aesculapius") does *not* protect against life drain in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") any longer.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)
- Having it intrinsically, either from [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") or being a [lycanthrope](/wiki/Lycanthrope_\(starting_race\) "Lycanthrope (starting race)"), [vampire](/wiki/Vampire_\(starting_race\) "Vampire (starting race)"), [undead slayer](/wiki/Undead_slayer "Undead slayer") or [necromancer](/wiki/Necromancer "Necromancer").

For those who don't mind the potential loss of a level, it is sufficient to have the amulet in open inventory, ready to be replaced when a monster begins attacking with a wand of draining. You will possibly lose two levels in the two turns it takes to remove the current amulet and put the amulet of draining on, but be able to regain one level almost instantly. A [very fast](/wiki/Very_fast "Very fast") monster, such as a [quickling](/wiki/Quickling "Quickling") or [fire vampire](/wiki/Fire_vampire "Fire vampire"), with a wand of draining could inflict even more lost levels, although luckily such monsters are relatively rare. The Hand of Vecna provides drain resistance when wielded, although since it is itself a poor weapon, one will have to find another way to kill the draining monster, or wait for it to run out of charges. One might also try carrying Excalibur or Stormbringer as a backup weapon.

Those who do not have a means of protection would be well-advised to pick up and/or stash any wands of draining they find.

### dNethack

Generally, drain resistance is not necessary as a full-time equipped item, as wands of draining have an abysmal drop rate. However, there are still some situations in which it's necessary or helpful, such as when fighting [Axus](/wiki/Auton#Axus "Auton") in the [Library of Law](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/dNethack_Dungeon_of_Ill-Regard "User:Chris/dNetHack/dNethack Dungeon of Ill-Regard"). It can be obtained by:

- Wielding Vampire Killer, Release from Care, The Lifehunt Scythe, The Silence Glaive, Stormbringer, Lolth's Fang, Liecleaver, Durin's Axe, Arcor Kerym, Aryvelahr Kerym, or The Rod of Seven Parts.
- Wearing Soulmirror, The Claws of the Revenancer, or Chromatic Dragon Scales.
- Carrying the Lance of Longinus, Sunbeam, Moonbeam, Veil of Latona, The Cloak of the Consort, The Heart of Ahriman, or The Iron Ball of Liberation.
- Wearing an [amulet of drain resistance](/wiki/User:Chris/dNethack/dNethack_Items#Amulets "User:Chris/dNethack/dNethack Items"), [helm of drain resistance](/wiki/User:Chris/dNethack/dNethack_Items#Helms_with_randomized_appearances "User:Chris/dNethack/dNethack Items"), or [black dragon scale mail](/wiki/User:Chris/dNethack/dNethack_Items#Body_armor "User:Chris/dNethack/dNethack Items")/[shield](/wiki/User:Chris/dNethack/dNethack_Items#Shields "User:Chris/dNethack/dNethack Items").
- Eating an amulet of drain resistance (always grants the intrinsic for 1000 turns.)

More information about the [artifacts](/wiki/DNetHack_Artifacts "DNetHack Artifacts") can be found on their page.

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [artilist.h in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 350](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/artilist.h#line350 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/artilist.h")
